alert.note: Alert for Carter; Powder River (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 3:43PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Carter and southeastern Powder River Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 341 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 19 miles west of Ridgeway, or 26 miles east of Broadus, moving northeast at 15 mph. Other storms in this cluster are slow moving and producing heavy rain, likely resulting in minor flooding. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, penny size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Biddle, Ridgeway, Hammond, Belltower, Boyes, Belle Creek and Ridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
